snippet: OSLO - In remarkable evidence played to a packed and shocked courtroom, recordings of cellphone calls made by Anders Behring Breivik, the gunman who admitted to carrying out Norway's worst peacetime atrocity, suggested that he tried twice to give...
abstract: OSLO - In remarkable evidence played to a packed and shocked courtroom, recordings of cellphone calls made by Anders Behring Breivik, the gunman who admitted to carrying out Norway's worst peacetime atrocity, suggested that he tried twice to give himself up and simply went on killing in the absence of officers to accept his surrender. Read Mark Lewis and Alan Cowell's article »

headline.main: Breivik Claims Self Defense as Trial Opens
